group_1.textRight: Tsukihiko, Ruri, congratulations on the wonderful@recovery.
It seems that the thugs were also arrested, so we@can all breathe easy again!

group_1.textLeft: ...Yes.

group_1.narration: This incident, too, could ultimately be traced back@to the conflict between East and West.
The men who'd attacked Tsukihiko and co.@on pretense of a quarrel had actually been@hired by distant relatives of Ruri...
...Relatives who were dissatisfied with@the peaceful resolution to the previous debate@over the marriage.
"Disgraced or no, Ruri is still a daughter of@our proud Mizuna house...!"
"We shall never let her be wed to a descendant of@our forefather's killer... and an East-side upstart, no less!"

group_1.textLeft: ...I still can't remember any of it myself, thanks to@that knock on the head...
...but it seems that my being attacked by thugs@was only partly true.
My friend tried to strike back at the attackers, see,@which led to one hell of a brawl...
...And when I stepped in to try and mediate, my@friend was actually the one who shoved me.

group_1.textRight: Goodness, what a funny...@[chara:301001:lipSynch_0][wait:1.2][chara:301001:lipSynch_1][chara:301001:motion_300][chara:301001:face_mtn_ex_030.exp.json][chara:301001:cheek_0]well, no, it's hardly anything to laugh at.

group_1.textLeft: No, laugh all you like! I insist!@I'm in tip-top shape now, after all.
Though my memory's still a bit foggy, I'm more than@well enough to go to work...
...and my darling Ruri and I are back en route@to being happily married.
The memories I have yet to regain are likewise beginning to return, day by day...
And I'm certainly not going to forget my poor@sisters' faces any more!

group_1.narration: Thus, Tsukihiko began regaining his memory,@little by little.
Ruri and Tsukihiko would soon enjoy their honeymoon,@and all was well...@or so it seemed.

group_1.textCenter: Good work, everyone.@Wonderful performances all around!

group_1.textLeft: | I agree. |
| One question, though. |
| Why did Ruri's expression become downcast at@the very end? |

group_1.textRight: It ought to serve as a good exercise in@understanding human emotions.

group_1.narration: She came to watch tonight's shoot in person,@as her creation@"seemed to be having a lot of fun in her reports".

group_1.textLeft: | Tsukihiko lost all memory of the childhood friend@whose role I'm playing. |
| With them, he lost the feelings he'd had in the@past when he made that vow to her... |
| And now he loves only his fiancée, Ruri.@...Is this correct? |

group_1.textRight: And considering the impending arrival of the@couple's wedding...
...it's unlikely that his friends and relatives would@deliberately remind him of his relationship with said@friend.

group_1.textLeft: | So Ruri should be happy. |
| A large obstacle has disappeared, and Tsukihiko is@likewise on the road to recovery. |

group_1.textRight: And yet, something clouds her expression.@What do you think that would be?

group_1.textLeft: | What indeed...? |
| Guilt over her theft of Tsukihiko from his@childhood friend? |
| Lingering doubt as to whether he would've chosen@her, had it not been for the accident? |

group_1.textRight: Well, it's true that if it hadn't been for the accident...
...their relationship would at least have followed a@different course of events.

group_1.textLeft: | Ah... one more possibility. |
| Tsukihiko is regaining his past memories as his@condition improves. |
| So the longing towards his childhood friend may@eventually revive as well. |
| Perhaps she could be anxious about that@prospect? |
| ...I don't know. I can't figure out which of those@could have caused Ruri such pain. |
| ...I see.@Human emotions are complex. |
